did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University, Blacksburg, Va.
did.unittitle: Center of Contemporary Architecture Media Collection, 2000-2009 (Bulk, 2000-2003)
did.abstract: The Center of Contemporary Architecture, a cultural non-governmental organization in Moscow, produced a weekly television series (2001-2004) titled Architecture Gallery which was supported by the Ford Foundation and authored and narrated by Irina Korobina. This collection contains selected videos from the Architecture Gallery television program produced by the C:CA. Also present are DVDs of other films produced by the C:CA, "Ivan Leonidov, the Architect" and "Netherlands' Coasts."

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Permission to publish material from the Center of Contemporary Architecture Media Collection must be obtained from Special Collections, Virginia Tech.
The films are still under the copyright of the Center of Contemporary Architecture.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Researchers wishing to cite this collection should include the following information: Center of Contemporary Architecture Media Collection, Ms2011-026, Special Collections, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University, Blacksburg, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The Center of Contemporary Architecture Media Collection was donated to Special Collections in 2005. An addition was received in 2011.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The processing, arrangement, and description of the Center of Contemporary Architecture Media Collection was completed in March 2011. Finding Aid updated December 2011 to incorporate an addition to the collection.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Center of Contemporary Architecture (C:CA) was founded in Moscow (2001) by the Russian Academy for Architecture and Building Science, Moscow Architectural Institute (MArchl), and State Institute of Art as a cultural non-governmental organization. Its mission is to support innovative trends in Russian architecture, serve as a point for creative activity in Russian architecture, develop a public consciousness regarding issues in architecture, and foster professional connections. It has been headed by Irina Korobina since its founding in 2001.

One of the C:CA's activities was the production of a weekly television series (2001-2004) titled Architecture Gallery which was supported by the Ford Foundation and authored and narrated by Irina Korobina. Episodes focused on issues such as urban development of European cities (especially Moscow), portraits of the world’s and Russia’s star architects, information on architectural events in Moscow and international events such as the Venice Biennale and the Pritzker Prize.
For more detail about the organization and its activities you can visit its English language webpage here.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: This collection contains selected videos from the Architecture Gallery television program produced by the C:CA and under the supervision of C:CA Director Irina Korobina. Also present are DVDs of other films produced by the C:CA, "Ivan Leonidov, the Architect" and "Netherlands' Coasts." Leonidov was a prominent figure in the Soviet Avant-Garde movement.
The videos are on VHS with a converted copy to allow playback on United States VCRs. The materials are in Russian although the converted VHS tapes have English titles.

controlaccess.head: Subjects:
controlaccess.subject: International Archive of Women in Architecture (IAWA)

did.unittitle: Architecture Gallery, "Starchitects in the World," VHS

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Produced by the C:CA and starring the author of the film Dr. Irina Korobina, Director of the State Museum of Architecture in Moscow.

Film attempts to discover the attractiveness of contemporary architecture of the Netherlands. Architects featured include: Rem Koolhass, Winy Maas, Jacob van Rijs, Michiel Riedijk, Kas Oosterhuis, Adriaan Geuze, Rene Van Zuuk, and many others.

did.unittitle: TV Film, "Ivan Leonidov, The Architect," DVD
